reference.title: Paragraph Formats
reference.shortdesc: Paragraph formats apply to entire paragraphs of text.

section.p:
Use paragraph formats if you want to apply a certain formatting to a particular section of your content.
Body All content that serves as the body of this document uses the Body paragraph format. For example, any text that is not part of a table, numbered or bulleted list should use the Body paragraph format.
Bullet, Bullet2 The Bullet formats allow you to create unordered lists. The Bullet formats provide you with a level of indentation that matches exactly with your Body paragraph format. The Bullet2 format provides you with one level of indentation from the Body paragraph format.
Chapter Title The Chapter Title paragraph format allows you to identify new chapters in your document. This format uses autonumbering to append chapter numbers to your headings.
ExpandCollapse The ExpandCollapse format creates links that display or hide content in an expand/collapse section in generated output. Apply this format to any text that you want to serve as a link for an expand/collapse section.
GlossDef The GlossDef format should be applied to the glossary definition for glossary terms.
GlossTerm Content with the GlossTerm format should always precede the GlossDef format.
Heading1, Heading 2, and Heading 3 Heading formats can be used to label titles for major sections in source documents. Each heading format differs in font size and font weight.
Indent1, Indent2 The Indent formats should be used when you want to apply a greater level of indentation to your Body format. Use Indent1 if you want to indent your content one level in from the Body format. Use Indent2 if you want to indent your content two levels in from the Body format.
Number, Number1 The Number formats allow you to create ordered lists. The first item in your list should use the Number1 format, and the content following the first item should use the Number format.
ProcedureTitle The ProcedureTitle format should be used for procedure introductory statements. Apply this format to any text that introduces the procedure. This format does not create expand/collapse sections that display or hide steps in a procedure. If you want to create procedure introductory statements that display or hide steps in a procedure, use the ExpandCollapse paragraph format.
RelatedTopic The RelatedTopic format creates related topics links in generated output. Apply this format to a list of cross-references that you want to display as links in your generated output.
